author: CamberbrickGreen
title: Chunky Retro Racer
review:
Ever cleared the town to hold a race? The racing cars were formula 1 inspired and this chap was none too flash with his chunky blue cart but minifigure race cars are as such; very small, usually chunky and
slightly aerodynamic to stand a chance of winning.

Minifigures:
  • The driver in a red helmet, white outfit with thin red stripes/ thick blue stripe.
Hard Pushed
There are much more flashy cars out there but at least this driver has not sold out to the corporate sponsorship and has just a smart white number '3' on the blue bodywork. A strange engine exists at the back in the form of two red jets but I doubt minifigure car racing had engine rules (?!) and getting a set of complete numbers was a fun part in collecting them.

What a 1980's stripey top! You'll be hard pushed to find a minifigure whose seen dead in that anymore but at least it rockets this set into a potential bricklist of 'Retro Classics'. As a potential favourite racing car, it feels harsh to rate it just three bricks though others out there were indeed better but this remains the funniest and a most retro underdog.

Doubtful that I can ever get rid of this one, I noticed it is also the second set released in Racing subtheme so quite worthy of its little build that includes the excellent old cornered wheel arches. Along with blue plates the wheel arches stack on to the main shaft plate along with the red err engine rockets and the slant with number 3. Position the wheels, seat the driver and its away.

Town racing remains a broad sub-theme that allows 'wacky racing' with all manner of crazy vehicles or a specific type vehicle race in a multitude of custom designs. What race car collecting excitement! Does anyone else need a number '2'?
